headline.main: Seeking Freedom and Security at a Time of War

lead_paragraph: To the Editor: ''Civil Liberty vs. Security: Finding a Wartime Balance'' (front page, Nov. 18) discusses the suspension of the writ of habeas corpus during the Civil War and the detention of Japanese-Americans during World War II, but neglects to mention that the Supreme Court ultimately held the former unconstitutional and that the latter is so universally regarded as disgraceful that the United States has apologized and paid reparations.
abstract: John S Koppel letter, commenting on Nov 18 article, criticizes infringement of civil liberties in US in wake of Sept 11 terrorist attacks
